meanings.definition: To provide too little food or nourishment to (someone or something)
meanings.sent1: The pet owner accidentally underfeeds his cat, making it hungry all the time.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to underfeed your plants, as they need proper nourishment to grow.
meanings.sent3: The picky eater joked that the chef always underfeeds him, leaving him wanting more.
meanings.sent4: The neglectful gardener underfeeds his flowers, causing them to wither and fade away.
meanings.sent5: She realized her mistake when she saw how underfeeding the fish led to their poor health.

meanings.definition: To give insufficient food or nourishment to (someone or something)
meanings.sent1: The busy schedule often causes her to unintentionally underfeed herself during the day.
meanings.sent2: The orphanage ensures they never underfeed the children in their care.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful chef tends to underfeed the customers, leaving them unsatisfied.
meanings.sent4: The farmer underfeeds his livestock, resulting in weaker animals.
meanings.sent5: He learned the hard way that underfeeding the birds in winter can have dire consequences.
